issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: When killing an app, app first moves to KILLING state, If RMAppAttempt receives the attempt_unregister event before attempt_kill event,  it'll ignore the later attempt_kill event.  Hence, RMApp won't be able to move to KILLED state and stays at KILLING state forever.
fields.summary: Killing app may hang while AM is unregistering

comments.body: Uploaded a patch to handle the possible attempt_unregistered, attempt_failed, attempt_finished state at app_killing state.

Instead, we could get rid of the killing state completely and let app stay at the original state and change RMApp to handle attempt_killed state at each possible state.  this way, we could avoid race condition like this.  I'll file a separate  jira to do this.

{code}
+    .addTransition(RMAppState.KILLING,
+        EnumSet.of(RMAppState.ACCEPTED, RMAppState.FINAL_SAVING),
+        RMAppEventType.ATTEMPT_FAILED,
+        new AttemptFailedTransition(RMAppState.ACCEPTED))
{code}
This is not correct. If app accept kill signal from the user, we should not continue running the app.

bq. This is not correct. If app accept kill signal from the user, we should not continue running the app.
right,  updated the patch to kill the app if this is not the last attempt. if the failed attempt is the last attempt, the app state remains failed.
